refnamediv.refpurpose:
substitute
nulls, replacing
replacing nulls Substitute new value for null values in an array

refsect1.title: Summary
refsect1.para: Substitute null values in one array with non-null values from another array.

The substitute operator renders attributes in null_array non-nullable. If an attribute has null values, you can use this operator to substitute null values in the array and change the nullability of the attribute in the schema.

listitem.para: The starting indices for both arrays must be zero.
The substitute array must have exactly one attribute.

informalexample.para: This example replaces all null values in an array with zero.

step.para:
Create an array m4x4_null with a nullable attribute:
AFL% CREATE ARRAY m4x4_null <val:double null>[i=0:3,4,0,j=0:3,4,0];

Store null in the second row of m4x4_null and 100 in all the other cells:
AFL% store(build(m4x4_null,iif(i=1,null,100)),m4x4_null); {i,j} val {0,0} 100 {0,1} 100 {0,2} 100 {0,3} 100 {1,0} null {1,1} null {1,2} null {1,3} null {2,0} 100 {2,1} 100 {2,2} 100 {2,3} 100 {3,0} 100 {3,1} 100 {3,2} 100 {3,3} 100

Create a single-cell array called substitute_array
AFL% CREATE ARRAY substitute_array <missing:double>[i=0:0,1,0];

Put value 0 into substitute_array:
AFL% store(build(substitute_array,0),substitute_array); {i} missing {0} 0

Use the substitute operator to replace the null-valued cells in m4x4_null with 0-valued cells:
AFL% substitute(m4x4_null,substitute_array); {i,j} val {0,0} 100 {0,1} 100 {0,2} 100 {0,3} 100 {1,0} 0 {1,1} 0 {1,2} 0 {1,3} 0 {2,0} 100 {2,1} 100 {2,2} 100 {2,3} 100 {3,0} 100 {3,1} 100 {3,2} 100 {3,3} 100
